title: The Outlook for the U.S. Economy
content: Table 1. Summary of Economic Projections  Note: Central tendency of the economic projections of Federal Reserve Board members and Federal Reserve Bank  presidents, March 2018. Projections of change in real gross domestic product (GDP) and inflation are from the fourth  quarter of the previous year to the fourth quarter of the year indicated. Projections for the unemployment rate are for the  average civilian unemployment rate in the fourth quarter of the year indicated. PCE is personal consumption expenditures.  Source:  Federal Reserve Board, March 2018 projection materials, available at https://www.federalreserve.gov/  monetarypolicy/fomccalendars.htm.    Variable 2018 2019 2020 Longer run  Change in real GDP 2.7 2.4 2.0 1.8  December projection 2.5 2.1 2.0 1.8  Unemployment rate 3.8 3.6 3.6 4.5  December projection 3.9 3.9 4.0 4.6  PCE inflation 1.9 2.0 2.1 2.0  December projection 1.9 2.0 2.0 2.0  Core PCE inflation 1.9 2.1 2.1  December projection 1.9 2.0 2.0  Federal funds rate 2.1 2.9 3.4 2.9  December projection 2.1 2.7 3.1 2.8  Median (Percent)
